channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large picture has be dumped beside a litter bin, which is itself overflowing, near the bus stop for buses going in the direction of Welling., 22nd November
item.description:
Usually the bin is emptied regularly, but yesterday evening I picked up a lot of litter around the area due to the bin being full, and this evening along with more litter on the ground I also found this dumped picture.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crook Log, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SAFETY CONCERN Telegraph pole has hanging cable. Dangerous, 22nd November
item.description:
Telegraph pole no DP1932 has a cable hanging at head height to an adult pedestrian. The coiled cable is swinging in the wind. It hot my head as I walked by. Needs attention promptly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Road, Ponders End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Bournemouth Close, 22nd November
item.description:
Excessive fly tipping throughout Bournemouth Close that is getting worse and worse each month. Please clean and use CCTV enforcement to detract fly tippers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Parkstone Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Broken, dangerous path in alleyway, 22nd November
item.description:
A huge lorry delivered steels to Roxby House on Sat 22nd Nov and had broken the tarmac of the alleyway. They tried to cover it with leaves, but the ground has been broken into lots of pieces, there are deep cracks and it is a dangerous trip hazard and needs fixing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rogue Commercial Big, 22nd November
item.description:

item.title: Rough sleeping + smell of hurine + rubbish dumped, 22nd November
item.description:
Eccleston Square and the area around the station is becoming a junkyard. Please take a structural look at this and consider moving the bins to Belgrave Road as these are attracting mice, foxes and junkies. Zombies are constantly walking around taking and selling drugs and no effective actions are taken. The situation has deteriorated dramatically in the last year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hugh Street, Victoria, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
